Job_Title: IT CRM Assistant Data Manager-North Asia &SAPMENA
Job_Descriptions: Context: Digital Transformation is at the heart of L’Oreal group strategy. A number of initiatives have already been launched at the IT organization level touching various business and technological domains: e-commerce, eMarketing, CRM…Furthermore, the APAC regions has countries that are at the forefront of the Digital revolutions: countries like Japan, Korea and China are continuously stretching what is possible in this domain. IT CRM team helps to provide solutions for our business partners to put consumer at the heart of this transformation which help us achieve consumer centricity, digital strategy and seamless experiential brands. The role: This role will support the IT CRM Media & Data Manager in Asia Pacific, Middle East & North Africa to own the data domain for these geography. This role is also responsible for communicating with cross-functional stakeholders and vendors to ensure data strategy direction is aligned with project roadmap. This is a role which requires someone to have strong project management and problem-solving skills with understanding in data. It’s a role which is suited to someone with a mixture of technical and business background. The person in the position will have responsibility for the roadmap, and decision making for data domain to ensure projects are delivered on time with right data strategies aligned with the IT CRM Media & Data Manager. At the same time, partnering with our business partner to define their business requirements and communicate with IT team. For a start, this role will be responsible for data consultation in Consumer Data Platform (CDP), Consumer Data Service (CDS), Loyalty, and Analytics. This role is based in Singapore/Shanghai and reports to IT CRM Media & Data Manager Key job accountabilities: - Be the main contact point and trusted data advisor for the stakeholder group and first escalation poin for data domain - Discussion making on data modeling, data querying, data quality check and business use caes - Manage the day-to-day activities of data domain, monitor progress and regurarly update stakeholders - Coordinate and Participate in UAT testing to gurantee quality of data solutions - Effectively communicate with internal stakeholders and external partners to ensure aligmenents to objective - Assistant vendor management for data related tasks Profile & Position Requirements: •         Minimum 3 years experiences with data solution and business intelligence projects •         Experienced in working across business/IT stakeholders on analytical project to deliver results •         Knowledge in Data model design, Data Storage, ETL, and Data collection & mangement •         Knowledge in SQL •         Good working attitude and strong ownership •         Knowledge in CRM technologies (Telium, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, and loyalty etc) is a plus •         Prior Experience with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Looker) is a plus •         Agile project management experience is a plus •         Digital, and/or eCommerce related development expertise is a plus •         Japanese speaking is a plus

As a Principal Consultant for Data, you are passionate about data and technology solutions, are driven to learn about them and keep up with market evolution. You will play an active role in delivering modern data solutions for clients including data ingestion/data pipeline design and implementation, data warehouse & data lake architectures, cognitive computing and cloud services. You are enthusiastic about all things data, have strong problem-solving and analytical skills, are tech savvy and have a solid understanding of software development. In this role you will be helping build the Rackspace data practice across APJ.  You will be the expert in region and support sales, pre-sales and delivery of our data projects.  Rackspace has data expertise in the US and we need you to collaborate with them to ensure global standardization and delivery. As the local expert you’ll be involved in presenting to customers and at events.  As well as promoting our capabilities to our hyper scale partners.  As the data team grows there is opportunity to become a mentor and help shape the data practice. More generally, Principal Consultants are the cornerstone of our delivery success, overseeing our most strategic accounts. They are empowered to make key delivery decisions and work closely with technical resources as well as our Engagement/Project Managers to ensure our customers experience successful outcomes. At any time, a Principal Consultant will be accountable for multiple projects across multiple customers. Helping to secure new business and delivering against contracted services and revenue realisation targets. They ensure the project team remains focused, and work closely with managers to ensure team performance. The Principal Consultant needs to understand client's business and technology requirements within their domain, identify gaps, areas of opportunity, and design future state improvements as well as providing pre-sales support for engagements. It is expected the blend between delivery and pre-sales will be approximately 50/50. Key Accountabilities: Data Specialisation: ·       Lead, define and implement end-to-end modern data platforms in support of analytics and AI use cases ·       Collaborate with enterprise architects, data architects, ETL developers & engineers, data scientists, and information designers to lead identification and definition of required data structures, formats, pipelines, metadata, and workload orchestration capabilities ·       Address aspects such as data privacy & security, data ingestion & processing, data storage & compute, analytical & operational consumption, data modeling, data virtualization, self-service data preparation & analytics, AI enablement, and API integrations ·       Be the technical liaison between customers and engineering teams ·       Be a big data evangelist by educating a variety of customers on the value of cloud and data services General Consultancy: ·       Present recommendations to clients using both written deliverables and face-to-face discussions ·       Develop deep relationships with clients and act as the single point of contact for client executives on data engagements ·       Guide customers during big data and cloud adoption by: ·       Understanding drivers of technology change ·       Building business cases to undertake technology change ·       Lead discovery sessions with stakeholders, including interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, client on-site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, and data analysis for technology change ·       Identify gaps in customer maturity and capabilities in relation to their data strategy. ·       Identify areas of opportunity, and recommend future state improvements ·       Work with Engagement / Project Managers to plan the delivery of Job_Title: Global Markets Operations, Prime Brokerage Operations, Cash Management, Associate
Job_Descriptions: Global Markets Operations, Prime Brokerage Operations, Cash Management, Associate Operations is a dynamic, multi-faceted division that partners with all areas of the firm to deliver banking, sales and trading and asset management capabilities to clients around the world. Alongside this vital service delivery role, Operations provides essential risk management and control, preserving and enhancing the firm's assets and its reputation. Operations spans all product lines and markets, serving as internal business partners who develop the processes and controls, and help to specify the systems that deliver accuracy, timeliness and integrity to our business. The Prime Brokerage (PB) Operations team operates in a dynamic environment where you will be required to multi-task with the right priority in order to support a fast paced business environment. Duties Prime Brokerage (PB) within Global Markets Division Operations, provides a suite of services to hedge funds and other professional investors. Middle office initiatives are focused on increasing STP to drive scale across the Securities business; with an emphasis on high STP rate and quick query resolution to provide a seamless client experience. This is to be achieved in part by a multi-year system and flow convergence program, as well as consolidating functions across Operations to form a broader Equity middle office. Responsibilities include: Review & approve cash transactions including payments & journals Respond to various cash queries from the internal stakeholders and external clients Understand internal and external regulations Analyze and resolve exceptions timely Evaluate and escalate risk items to management and the business Make suggestions for the improvement of process efficiencies & controls Maintain close relationships with multiple internal teams, which includes the treasury team, account managers and risk managers Work very closely with other regional counterparts to ensure follow the sun / pass the book are maintained Requirements: Individual who has strong risk control mind-set and detail oriented in performing daily tasks & checkouts Strong preference is to have product background (Cash Management/Prime Brokerage) Minimum 5-7 years of work experience in Operations Team player Commitment to high quality client service Good communication skills, ability to show initiative and strategic problem solving Our core value is building strong relationships with our institutional clients, which include corporations, financial service providers, and fund managers. We help them buy and sell financial products on exchanges around the world, raise funding, and manage risk. This is a dynamic, entrepreneurial team with a passion for the markets, with individuals who thrive in fast-paced, changing environments and are energized by a bustling trading floor. ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world. We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers. We're committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Job_Title: Oliver Wyman - Research Analyst / Senior Research Analyst – Financial Services - Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job title: Research Analyst / Senior Research Analyst – Financial Services Department: Knowledge Services Research Office/region: Shanghai or Singapore / Asia Pacific Reports to: Senior Research Team Manager Job Overview: The consulting business of Oliver Wyman offers a dynamic and fast-growing environment with an excellent team spirit. Knowledge Services comprises an international team of 120 staff providing research and knowledge management support to consultant teams globally. We are looking for an experienced researcher to join our Financial Services team who will support our consultants by sourcing and synthesizing market data, industry developments and company information necessary for the successful execution of client projects and business development initiatives. This role requires direct ownership of research and the ability to independently triage workflow.  The role requires the ability to develop strong relationship with consulting team and help consultants to scope and develop their research needs, conduct timely, accurate and cost-effective research for focused needs, and deliver compelling synthesized end products which include some analyses. The development focus will be toward industry, market and/or practice specialization and resource expertise. This will further enhance your output by partly improving your synthesis or data by incorporating some analysis and/or interpretation of the results (the “so-what”) based on your growing understanding and knowledge about the subject matter. You will also begin to take coaching responsibilities for more junior research colleagues.  Provide ad hoc and programmatic analysis of key business drivers related to the different practices. Key Responsibilities: Work with a wide range of information tools and proprietary databases to provide research for client projects and business development. Provide both quick solutions and in-depth research for the business. Synthesize information and glean key concepts and trends from the information.  Able to provide own point of view and basic insights in the deliverables. Conduct selected primary research as required - includes mystery shopping, expert interviews, conference attendance and notes, facilitating access to primary research capabilities Leverage the Knowledge Management team to provide joint solutions on projects. Assist in the education and training of the consulting staff both with research issues generally, and with end-user training specifically. Work within the framework of the Asia Pacific based team, sharing work and experience and helping build the research function in the region. Collaborate with consultants engaged in client service, business development or knowledge/intellectual capital building by delivering highly relevant and well-synthesized research Building deep expertise in Financial Services sector, related topics and master tools and resources to support your data analysis. Develop strong trusted relationships with practice members and research colleagues to promote effective knowledge sharing and positive work environment. Scope and develop research need of our consultants and partners in order to conduct timely, accurate and cost-effective research. Keep abreast of key industry developments/innovations to promote awareness across the Financial Services team. Manage large data sets, conduct data analyses and build/validate models Take ownership and lead customized research products / services, including identifying opportunities for customized research products / services, sector/company fact packs, benchmarks, trend analysis or support for OW reports Demonstrate strong collaboration skills, including coaching junior research colleagues and continually collaborating with global Knowledge Services team members by sharing ideas and experiences Person Specification: 3-5 years of prior experience as a researcher, analyst or consultant at an investment bank, private equity firm, asset manager, law firm, research specialist provider or management consultancy Prior experience at a management consultancy, asset manager, bank, or insurance firm (as either a consultant, analyst or in a research role) is preferable Knowledge of the Asia Pacific market and the Financial Services industry Solid problem-solving skills and inquisitive nature allowing you to deliver an effective research product ensuring your credibility as a trusted team member. Excellent research synthesis skills allowing you to draw out key insights and to provide basic data analysis. Advanced Excel and PPT skills Familiarity with Bloomberg, Eikon, Capital IQ or similar market data tools Strong technical aptitude - knowledge of Python, Web Scraping beneficial but not critical Skills and Attributes : Strong capability in written and oral Mandarin and English Team player who has experience of and has enjoyed working as part of a team. Ability to efficiently prioritize research work to satisfy competing demands. Ability to operate under pressure and stick to tight deadlines Attention to detail and accuracy. Excellent communication skills. Flexible attitude, hard-working. Ability to triage work independently and effectively. Able to work independently with little supervision Fluency in English. Proficiency in one or more Asian languages is an advantage. Growth-mind-set focused on commitment to continual client service and personal professional development enhancements Strong IT skills – proficiency with Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).

We are one of the largest investment management organizations in the world, with over 1000 people working together to create long-term value. Investment Services Private Market and Finance Department The Investment Services Private Market and Finance Department is responsible for investment services for the private market and financial management across the GIC group. It is responsible for providing operations and reporting support to the private market business of GIC as well as budgeting, accounting, payment processing, cash management, tax and financial & management reporting services to all departments, corporate management companies and the global offices of the GIC group. It is involved in deal structuring and closing, transaction processing, administration and accounting of investment holding companies, review of financial controls for asset operations, cash & securities reconciliation, valuation and financial reporting for assets under management, and external debt financing. We are looking for a suitable candidate to join our Finance & Accounting team as an Associate, Private Markets. Preparing accounting reconciliations, review of investment holding company accounts and liaison with external auditors; Corporate secretarial work relating to investment holding companies Requirements Bachelor in Accounting, Finance or relevant disciplines. At least 2 years relevant accounting work experience in the finance, accounting or private equity industry. Committed and motivated individuals who are meticulous, and enjoys working in a fast-paced dynamic environment. Proficient in Microsoft Office applications and have practical working experience with accounting software systems

Job_Title: Corporate Development Specialist/Manager, Greater China North Asia (Senior Associate/Associate Director)
Job_Descriptions: Corporate Development Specialist/Manager, Greater China North Asia (Senior Associate/Associate Director) At Bank of Singapore, we are constantly on the lookout for exceptional individuals to join our team. We promote a culture of openness, teamwork and fairness. Most importantly, we invest in our people through our programmes that develop them on both professional and personal levels. Besides attractive remuneration packages, we offer non-financial benefits and opportunities to develop your potential within OCBC Group’s global network of subsidiaries and offices. If you have passion, drive and the will to succeed, rise to the challenge today! With the rapid growth of Greater China & North Asia (GCNA) business in Singapore, the Corporate Development Manager will be responsible for business performance analysis, strategy planning and execution, as well as project, general management support and administrative activities within the business area for the development of GCNA business. This role is part of the Corporate Development team and will support GCNA SG in performance/sales management and drive key initiatives for GCNA including Independent Asset Managers (IAM) strategy, Global Investors Family Offices (GIFO) Excellence Centre development and key Onshore Projects. RESPONSIBILITIES Perform tactical data mining and in-depth business analysis to provide insights to senior management, to facilitate formulation of business strategies (e.g. identify trends and patterns in data to generate business insights relating to sales performance, client behaviour, client segmentation, product sales behaviour, transaction patterns, etc.) Design and prepare monthly MIS reports for GMH and Market Heads (MHs) in GCNA SG to review team and individual RM performance. Consolidate business pipelines, forecast upcoming business performance, identify gaps, and provide findings and areas of improvement to GMH/MHs. Engage through regular meetings to discuss findings and articulate recommendations. Support strategic business planning, financial analysis, project management and co-ordinate administrative activities. Drive strategic development initiatives as assigned from time to time to support the direction and growth of the business, particularly IAM strategy and GIFO Excellence Centre development for GCNA SG. Assist MH in Onshore Project in both China and Taiwan. Work alongside with MH and support them in the coordination, analytics, preparation of presentation materials and project management reporting. Coordinates administrative activities related to general services Other projects as designated from time to time to support the direction of the business. Qualifications Competence Requirements: Demonstrate strategic thinking skills, analytical and experienced in data mining research to make business recommendations. Proficient in Microsoft Office (PowerPoint and Excel) and database analysis. Take strong ownership of assigned tasks, highly self-driven and fast learner. Effective team player. Discreet, act with high integrity standard. Possess strong communication, influencing and presentation skills. Fluency in English/Chinese is essential to handle China/other markets. Ability to read Chinese is preferred. Education Requirement: Bachelor's degree, minimum 6 - 8 years' experience

Job_Title: Head of Communications, Corporate Affairs and Brand & Marketing (CABM), Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Head of Communications, Corporate Affairs and Brand & Marketing (CABM), Singapore About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities This role is responsible for the strategy and delivery of full suite of communications for the Singapore (SG) franchise and businesses, to protect the Bank reputation, strengthen brand profile & and improve employee experiences through various channels, platforms, and partners. Strategy Provide strategic and tactical communications advice to the Singapore Management Team (MT). Proactive management of reputational risks, working in partnership with Singapore MT, Group and Asia Corporate Affairs and Brand & Marketing (CABM) peers Support the Head of CABM, Singapore in building the external profile of the Singapore franchise, Singapore Chief Executive Officer (CEO), Singapore MT and the Bank and businesses - including the proactive identification of opportunities for external profiling. Identify opportunities which directly support business operations and the achievement of business goals. Responsible for managing client communications, in partnership with the businesses, and Group and Asia Communications teams Key Stakeholders Internal Country / Regional level: Singapore CEO Singapore Management Team (MT) Key business and function leads (including support functions) Asia CABM Head and Asia Communications Head Country CABM and Communications heads in ASEAN cluster markets (Malaysia, Thailand and Vietnam) Group level: Group Internal Comms and Culture Comms teams Group Executive Comms and Strategic Media, Content & Campaigns, Reputation & Issues Management Heads Strategic Comms Partners - Corporate, Commercial & Institutional Banking (CCIB), Consumer, Private and Business Banking (CPBB), Employee Comms, Function comms External Media editors and journalists (local media, key online influencers) Agency partners (social media, etc) Other vendors Other Responsibilities Develop, implement and evaluate the annual Singapore communications plan (covering strategic and executive communications, business communications, financial reporting, employer branding, sustainability and community investment) Build both external and internal profile of the Singapore CEO, Business and Function Heads, with a focus on strategy, business capabilities and achievements, thought leadership, management expertise, community initiatives and people engagement events. Maintain control of issues that have the potential to cause reputational damage to the Bank. Manage crises and proactively deal with threats to the Bank's reputation. Identify communication opportunities to build internal awareness and pride; and manage relationships with the media to secure strategic interviews during critical corporate milestones. Develop and pro-actively pitch op-eds and story idea/s to the media that fit the Bank's strategic agenda. Develop and maintain key message documents and maintain key data points that back up the Bank's strategic corporate plan. Ensure compliance with the Bank's communications Standards and Policies in-country. Work with Group and Asia communications teams and key stakeholders to ensure coordinated approach to communications, as well as consistency in delivery for quality outcomes Use new technologies to deliver better and more targeted content with greater audience segmentation, both internally and externally. Drive an insights-driven and measurement focused approach that sets clear objectives, metrics and measures key results for all initiatives to assess impact of our efforts and drive a continuous improvement approach. Our Ideal Candidate Functional Knowledge & Experience A communications expert with at 15+ years in an external and internal communications role in a financial institution or international conglomerate At least a bachelor's degree in a communication or business-related discipline Experience in driving external and internal communications strategies Experience in managing teams Excellent working knowledge of media including deadlines, interests, agendas, etc. Excellent relationships with the media at all levels Skills Ability to analyse sentiments and customise communications according to target audience; and effectively communicate complex ideas to diverse audiences Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to provide sound and credible strategic advice, and constructive challenge to senior executives Strong people management and relationship building skills Ability to operate with the highest integrity and discretion Critical thinking skills to exercise judgement and continuously looking for better and more effective ways of working Collaborative and able to encourage creativity, generate new ideas for effective implementation of business solutions Ability to think on their feet and to respond calmly and effectively in high-pressure situations or environment Possess excellent communication and presentation skills as well as in planning and organisation Ability to lead and guide in the design, development of multi-channel communications campaigns, and championing the use of innovative communications vehicles and practices Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

The ideal candidate should have previous branch or venue management experience • Strong written and verbal English communication skills. Mandarin a bonus. • Able to adapt well to difficult situations / customers and resolve issues in an empathetic and professional manner • Great staff management skills and must be a team player • Organised and able to handle busy environments • Self directed and able to take initiative • Good computer skills (booking systems, POS systems, Excel, etc.) • Handyman skills a bonus • Café and/or bar experience a bonus • Citizen, PR or DP preferred The role: • Full time position, ~7-8 hours a day 5.5 days per week (specific hours can be agreed) • Competitive fixed salary + bonus • Start ASAP 3 month probation period About Virtual Room • The future of entertainment is now here with Virtual Room – the world’s best team-based VR experience located centrally in Chinatown, Singapore • A truly immersive and mind-blowing adventure for groups of 2 to 4 players who must work together to the save the world in a totally realistic environment • Each player has their own dedicated room, specially designed and equipped with the latest VR gear. They will get to move around, search for items, manipulate objects and collaborate with their fellow team members. • Part of the global Virtual Room business, established in 2017 with 18 branches worldwide.

See job description for details NCS is a leading information and communications technology (ICT) and communications engineering services provider across the Asia-Pacific region. It is headquartered in Singapore and a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Singtel Group. NCS has in-depth domain knowledge and unique capabilities that create business value for customers. We offer a broad range of services, including consulting, systems development and integration, business process outsourcing, infrastructure management and solutions, and technology solutions. We deliver end-to-end ICT solutions to help governments and enterprises realise business value through digital transformation and the innovative use of technology This job role is supported by the structured development programme for mid-career professionals under the TechSkills Accelerator (TeSA) initiative, led by Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA) in partnership with SkillsFuture Singapore (SSG) and Workforce Singapore (WSG). The programme aims to provide Singaporeans aged 40 and above with a tech-related job while being reskilled or upskilled. Mid-career professionals will have the assurance of being employed in a paid job while attending structured Company-Led Training for in-demand tech skills. They will also gain experience in a tech role to tap into the good careers that the infocomm sector offers. Analyse functional requirements to translate into application design using established design methodologies and guidelines Ensure codes comply with NCS security guidelines Work with team lead to ensure design and programme codes conform to architecture and design standards, and that design satisfies functional and system requirements Participate in requirements gathering; work with Business Analysts in reviewing and refining functional specifications Participate in peer reviews to improve project quality Requirements: Able to demonstrate passion and willingness to upskill in applied role Excellent communication, interpersonal and written skills A technical mindset with great attention to detail This programme is open only to Singaporeans To all recruitment agencies: Singtel Group does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Singtel Group employees or any other company location. Singtel Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. By submitting your application for this job role, you agree that [Singtel] may collect, use and disclose your name and email address, which you have provided in the form, for the Infocomm Media Development Authority (TeSA Mid-Career Advance programme administrator) to send a follow-up email. Please note that information will be sent directly by the Infocomm Media Development Authority.

Job_Title: Senior Analyst, SPSI, Global Consumer Financial Services Finance
Job_Descriptions: Senior Analyst, SPSI, Global Consumer Financial Services Finance Reporting to the Head of SPSI, Global Consumer Financial Services, you will play a vital role in driving the performance of the business through the provision of insightful and timely analysis of channel sales performance, and leading in the review, design and implementation of various sales KPI scorecards and remuneration schemes across channels to support the achievement of annual sales targets. You will administer the quarterly incentive payment cycle and manage the annual sales incentives budget. Your key responsibilities will include: Working closely with various CFS business units and BP&A finance counterparts in the design of various sales KPI scorecards and remuneration schemes across channels. Design & Implement Sales Incentive schemes during the annual Planning cycle. Stress test the proposed incentive schemes. Identify opportunities to improve efficiency and effectiveness of the existing processes via automation/ redesign, RPA (Robotics) and system implementation. Administering quarterly incentive payment cycle and manage the annual sales incentives budget. Developing sales analytics capability to drive value and optimize sales efficiency across channels. Track and analyse the sales incentive payout/sales performance and highlight risks and opportunities against Plan delivery, and recommend improvements to uplift sales performance. Provide accurate and timely support for sales performance reporting, and ad-hoc MI requests for sales strategic planning / forecast. Document the system capabilities needed to address business challenges. Responsible for reviewing assigned business processes from end-to-end to identify and address operational and technological risks. Demonstrate up-to-date expertise in Information Systems and apply this to the development, execution (which includes develop and execute test plans), improvement of action plans by providing advice and guidance to others in the application of information and best practices. Support system conversions, upgrades, enhancements Review and design User Acceptance Test (UAT) cases. Qualifications Requirements Minimum Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline - Finance / Accountancy / Economics with over 6-8 years related working experience. Data analysis - Must have proficiency with SAS, SQL, Microsoft Excel, Access Python, Power BI & R knowledge will be advantageous Strong data management skills. Experience on simplifying data feeds to summarise business critical drivers. Prior data management/ warehousing experience will be an advantage. Broad-based understanding of consumer and wealth management business and product dynamics. Excellent communication - influencing, analytical and decision-making skills Strong business partnering experience - significant experience of working with senior management team - collaborate, influence and challenge senior stakeholders. Ability to work independently and effectively under pressure, multi-task, and lead through ambiguities. Must have experience working on small to medium scale projects as well as handling day-to-day operational requests from the business *LI-CL

Posted by: Shawn Sim Recruiter View profile & contact Marketnode is a SGX / Temasek Holdings joint venture focused on digital market infrastructure for traditional capital markets products (bonds, loans, funds). Given Marketnode’s expansion, we are looking for Hyperledger Fabric Engineers to join our team to support our business. We are looking for people who enjoy working in a startup environment - If you are passionate about fintech and digital assets and keen to work in a fintech backed by 2 major Singapore financial institutions, we’d like to talk to you. Marketnode is looking to deliver a robust DLT solution for Institutional Financial Markets globally, from our HQ in Singapore. Our technology roadmap includes extensive use of Hyperledger Fabric and Marketnode are now looking for Engineers to work on our implementation. We are seeking experienced candidates (1 to 4 years) less experienced candidates (0 to 1 years) and candidates without financial services experience of DLT such as academics DLT developers switching from another industry financial services industry experienced developers without formal workplace experience of DLT The role is a hybrid of: 50%: Hands-on development work on the Marketnode implementation of Hyperledger Fabric 10%: [Lead only] Training, mentoring and providing subject matter expertise to colleagues and business partners who will be collaborating with Marketnode 20%: Hyperledger Fabric development (20% of your time will be allocated to the Hyperledger Fabric Foundation) 20-30%: Production support (Level-2 and Level-3) Behaviours: We are an agile firm, we empower teams to deliver on a regular cadence We write clean code We write test cases as part of the development process We document what we do We are an API centric firm and that must influence all of our technology choices We are a greenfield operation, no technical debt.  We do not accrue technical debt. We collaborate and are all team players We share information, experience and expertise We are respectful of our colleagues, clients and partners and recognise their differences and similarities We deliver business value on a holistic basis We display ‘bias to action’ with ability and agility to execute Candidate profile Technologist at a vendor in the DLT space looking to move to an end-user firm Developer from outside of Financial Services looking to move into financial services at the cutting-edge Existing Hyperledger Fabric committer looking for a move into an end-user firm Recent graduate with Computer Science degree. Since DLT is a new field we will consider a range of experience from months to years. Hands-on Technologist with a more impressive GitHub than LinkedIn Hands-on developer looking to move from a traditional development role to a DLT based role Technologies we use : Go, Java, Javascript, Linux, AWS, Windows/MacOS (desktop), Github (Repository), Docker, DLT

Job_Title: Operations Manager, Corporate Action, Private Banking
Job_Descriptions: Operations Manager, Corporate Action, Private Banking Job Summary Singapore Permanent BBBH801809 Dec 15, 2021 Competitive Job Description Morgan McKinley is working in partnership with a Global Private Bank who is well known for their top notch bespoke wealth management services. The Singapore team is looking for an experienced Corporate Actions hire to join their Post-trade services operations team. Reporting to the team lead, you will be part of an experienced team handling corporate actions tax matters. Role and responsibilities Own and govern the control framework of the team (eg. EOD checklist, incident management, timely breaks management, etc.) Review and implement new business processes into the team Own and govern the processes are executed in line with the SOPs and ensure team members understand their roles Own and govern the client delivery framework and ensure team members understand the Client Experience and how they impact it Own the exceptions and escalations in the team and facilitate completion when necessary ad hoc tasks as assigned by Line Manager/HOD Face off to Internal and External stakeholders (e.g. Audit, Compliance, Products team, custodians, counterparties etc.) Participate in Corporate Action workflow workshops organized by project team and vendors Perform GAP analyses and work with users and Change the bank team to document the business requirements for all the processes and project changes required Support business to define, design, develop and implement the new "To-Be" processes base on market best practice Review and provide feedback on Functional Specifications for Corporate Action Workflow Work with project working group on testing scenarios and test pack for UAT Organize and perform training of the new processes for the team Key requirements 8 to 10 years of business in Corporate Actions processing Understanding of project life cycles, project planning and project management methodologies Proficient use of MS Visio, Microsoft Office, MS Project Experience with Financial applications such as T24, Swifts, IntelliMatch or equivalent will be an added advantage Excellent relationship building and communication skills High degree of initiative and previous experience working with cross functional teams towards effective process or system solutions If you are interested in the role and would like to discuss the opportunity further, please click apply now or email Hagen at hlee@morganmckinley.com for more information. Only shortlisted candidates will be responded to, therefore if you do not receive a response within 14 days please accept this as notification that you have not been shortlisted. Morgan McKinley Pte Ltd, EA License No: 11C5502 Lee Boon Hou (Hagen), Registration No: R1870932 hlee@morganmckinley.com

Distributed Ledger Technology Manager CITI INNOVATION LAB SINGAPORE Citi Innovation Lab strives to create world-class digital banking innovations in order to deliver a differentiated client experience and to enable the business to grow in new ways. Citi's Innovation Labs are a global network of innovation centres focused on delivering cutting edge solutions to Citi's Institutional Clients Group lines of business. Our Mission is to create a competitive advantage for our clients, manifested as change in the way they operate, by providing innovative solutions with strong client engagement, from idea to production, and by leveraging the entrepreneurial spirit within the Lab teams. Our Labs Network is a global organization that spans across Dublin, London, New York, Singapore & Tel Aviv, and various other locations globally. We focus on delivering innovative products using cutting-edge technologies in highly complex architectures and with the highest delivery standards. The labs perform research and implementation in many advanced domains spanning across AI, Machine Learning, NLP, Analytics, Distributed Ledger Technologies and many more. JOB DESCRIPTION Job Purpose Statement : A Distributed Ledger Technology Manager must be highly motivated, have a proven ability and experienced working with enterprise applications within industry. The successful candidate is expected to be a people manager with hands-on development experience in large-scale projects as well as developing proof of concept solutions to explore use-cases. Job Background / Context : Citi is committed to becoming the world's leading, global digital bank and to developing new and innovative ways of working to improve the experience our clients have of working with Citi and its products. We are looking for candidates who will help maintain our success as leaders within global payments, trade and treasury and accelerate our efforts to become a major part of the digital future. The successful individual must have background in innovation including research, analysis, design thinking, prototyping and also have solid commercial awareness. Key Responsibilities : In this role, you will be handling the following (but not limited to) responsibilities: Build a team of DLT engineers Take ownership of R&D experiments internally through collaboration in key lab initiatives. Provide SME (Subject Matter Expert) support on distributed systems and related projects. Design/Create mock-ups and prototypes Measuring Innovation Activities through the use of OKR's / Performance Scorecards / Targets and Milestones. Create / Contribute to the creation of new innovation project proposals including the pre socialization with stakeholders, the creation of business cases, cost and revenue projections. Manage multiple concurrent initiatives and projects of varying sizes & complexity Create new & maintain existing partner and vendor relationships . Effective upward and downward communication on notable progress to all key stakeholders Development Value : This role provides significant opportunities: You will gain significant experience of the technologies and businesses involved across Citi applications, giving you exposure to new and existing methodologies and systems as well as the opportunity to work with multiple teams around the globe. As a member of the Innovation Lab, you will have to opportunity to work with a team of highly motivated, T-shaped, smart individuals whose daily job is to think out of the box and look for disruptive opportunities with a commercial benefit. Exposure to newly released and upcoming technologies and the ability to positively contribute to the strategies of the business PERSON SPECIFICATION Knowledge / Experience Provide hands-on development leadership to small engineering teams. Experience in architecting distributed systems based solutions. Implementation experience of a reusable business process-modelling framework. Strong knowledge of full software development and testing lifecycle. Experience in driving business results through effective use of technology solutions. Exposure to defect management and analysis. Skills Excellent computer science fundamentals; demonstrable command of data structures, algorithms, and design patterns along with capability to translate them into working, elegant code. Experience delivering enterprise level Java development - at least two end-to-end cycles using a stack of related technologies (e.g. J2EE, Spring, Spring Batch, Spring Boot, Hibernate, Angular JS, AJAX, JSON, RESTful Web services, design patterns and databases) and Agile methodologies. Strong command of at least 3 languages, including but not limited to, Java, Python, C/C++ In-depth expertise in DLT technologies, preferably Ethereum based systems. Scala, Erlang, Golang, C, OCaml, Clojure, Haskell and Erlang. Intricate knowledge of controls for consistent deployment and management of applications. Experience documenting standards, procedures, interfaces and functional requirements. Proven history of delivering high-quality, increasingly complex, commercial software products. Strong command of distributed systems development. Deep understanding of secure coding practices. Advanced understanding of high-performance and high-availability coding techniques. Experience developing software targeting Linux environment. Strong engineering fundamentals (testing, code reviews, code structure, readable and maintainable code). Qualifications Batchelor degree in computer science required. Masters preferred. Experience as a software engineer, working in a globally distributed development environment. Experience working with innovative and emerging technology. Exceptional candidates who do not meet these criteria may be considered for the role provided they have the necessary skills and experience. Competencies Work effectively in cross-organizational situations and be enthusiastic about delivering quality solutions while working with world-class teams, processes and tools. Highly effective written and oral communication skills Excellent organizational, program and project management skills. Demonstrate excellent technical knowledge and equally enthusiastic about business acumen. Promote teamwork and maintain effective communication within and across groups. Promote and drive continuous process improvement especially in code quality, testability & reliability Ability to work under pressure during tight dead lines Excellent analytical and problem solving skills Strong commercial orientation with a deep passion for client-driven design and development throughout the SDLC. Demonstrated experience successfully collaborating with others in a dynamic, fast-paced, pressured environment. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. A self-starter who can deliver well as part of a team and embraces constructive feedback. Citi is an equal opportunities employer. Job Family Group: Technology Job Family: Applications Development Time Type: Full time Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi") invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. Job_Title: Associate Analyst - Banking, Corporate Finance, Project and Infrastructure
Job_Descriptions: Associate Analyst - Banking, Corporate Finance, Project and Infrastructure In a world where data is increasingly abundant, credible insight is rare. At Moody's, we help decision-makers to manage risk and identify opportunities by providing trusted insights and standards. The challenges we're facing are vast, yet incredibly meaningful. Therefore, we're looking for bright Associate Analysts who will bring innovative ideas to the workplace and are passionate about making a difference in our Ratings & Research Support department within Moody's Investor Services across multiple locations in Asia Pacific. Moody's hope to gather expressions of interest for current live vacancies in addition to roles we plan to hire throughout 2022. The Ratings & Research Support department is responsible for producing analytical support to Moody's Ratings and Research (R&R) function. In addition, this department will provide support for surveillance requirements and partner with R&R to provide the necessary support for issuer and investor interactions. What are the roles on offer? The Associate Analyst (AA) will collaborate closely with and support senior analysts in conducting credit analysis on an assigned portfolio by integrating credit inputs prepared by others, including Financial Data Analysts (FDAs), Associates and relevant external parties. In conducting credit analysis for their assigned portfolios, transactions or credit reviews, AAs will actively participate in rating committee discussions and interact with issuers and other market participants. The AA role is integral to Moody's focus on ratings accuracy, research and market outreach. The AA role will focus primarily on the group of Banking, Corporate Finance, Infrastructure Finance, Structured Finance, Sub- Sovereign, with the potential for cross-training in other groups. Portfolios: • Banking - Working within the financial institutions group involves performing qualitative and quantitative credit analysis on banks, , securities and finance companies. This role involves analysing financial information, identifying trends in data and applying sound analytical skills to form credit conclusions. AAs will also contribute to writing accurate, insightful, and relevant credit research on a wide range of credit themes. • Corporate Finance - Working within the corporate finance group involves performing qualitative and quantitative credit analysis for non-financial institutions spanning different sectors. This role involves preparing financial models, identifying trends in data and applying sound analytical skills to form credit conclusions. AA will contribute in preparing first draft of topical, insightful and high-quality research reports on rated companies, sector wide and cross-sector credit themes. • Infrastructure and Project Finance- Working within the infrastructure finance involves performing qualitative and quantitative credit analysis for utility, corporate infrastructure, and project finance issuers. The utility and corporate infrastructure covers public and private infrastructure companies mainly in the power generation, gas and water utilities, and airport industries. Project finance has responsibilities for issuers that are limited to a special purpose by law, regulation or contracts. Sectors involve includes project/concession financings of natural resource and energy projects (conventional and renewable power), water production and treatment, transport infrastructure (ports, airports). This role involves preparing financial models, identifying trends in data and applying sound analytical skills to form credit conclusions. AA will contribute in preparing first draft of topical, insightful and high-quality research reports on rated companies, sector wide and cross-sector credit themes . This is exciting time to join the Moody's RRS team. At Moody's, we celebrate our togetherness. We are a collaborative and diverse team of smart thinkers and builders who support each other at every step - in our work, our careers and our lives. Together we create the insights informing the decisions that move the world forward. And together we create the culture behind the careers that move our people forward. Imagine what we can build together, starting now. Portfolio Management • Perform credit analysis related to ratings, research, presentations, and investor outreach. This will include (but not be limited to): o Reviewing financial spreadsheets and charts prepared by others, analyzing data and financial statements, building and updating financial forecasts, and writing analytical commentary in accordance with Moody's methodologies. o Assisting with proprietary models and new financial projections as applicable, identifying trends in data, and applying analytical skills and judgment to form well-reasoned credit conclusions. o Reviewing transaction documents and building knowledge of cash flow and loss allocation rules (if applicable to the portfolio). • Develop strong working knowledge of Moody's methodologies and credit rating best practices, applying these with guidance from senior analysts. • Prepare draft rating committee memos, in collaboration with senior analysts. • Identify key factors that affect issuer credit profiles. • Interpret and analyze financial data and other credit inputs provided by other supporting teams. • Monitor credit quality of issuer and/or the portfolio trends by following market developments and news events, analyzing issuer reporting, and engaging with issuers directly for clarification and information. • As applicable to the LOB, monitor and attend earnings calls of companies within the assigned portfolio. • Attend and participate in rating committees, including offering analysis and opinion where appropriate. • Complete Credit Estimates (when necessary) used as credit input/factors in other portfolios. Research & Investor Outreach • Prepare draft core research as applicable to the portfolio e.g. credit opinions, issuer and sector comments, press releases, pre-sale and new issue reports etc. in collaboration with senior analysts. • Contribute to research strategy, including idea generation and preliminary drafting, adhering to Moody's research standards. • Attend investor briefings and issuer meetings as required; help prepare presentation materials where necessary; engage in discussions. • Build positive relationships with issuers including understanding of issuer's business and responding proactively to issuer enquiries. Credit Administration • Perform analytical tasks related to portfolio reviews and other credit projects. • Operate applicable ratings and research systems and utilize software relevant to the rating group. Identify any data issues and follow up with senior analysts. • Demonstrate sound understanding and judgment in applying Moody's processes, documentation standards and best practices, adhering to all laws and policies. Experience/Qualifications • Minimum undergraduate/ first level degree (e.g. Bachelor's Degree, or equivalent qualifications). • Some relevant experience, preferably minimum of 1 year. Specific industry experience may be required depending on the portfolio. • Accounting background with strong focus in financial analysis (e.g., through coursework, CFA or equivalent, or relevant work experience). Especially for Banking, Corporate Finance, Infrastructure and Project Finance, Insurance and Sub - Sovereign • Working knowledge of MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint. • Solid verbal, written communication and interpersonal skills. • Ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. • Additional languages are also a bonus - Japanese (Japan based role), Korean & Chinese (Hong Kong based roles), Chinese (China based roles) Rating & Research Support Moody's is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law. Moody's (NYSE: MCO) is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions. Our data, analytical solutions and insights help decision-makers identify opportunities and manage the risks of doing business with others. We believe that greater transparency, more informed decisions, and fair access to information open the door to shared progress. With over 11,000 employees in more than 40 countries, Moody's combines international presence with local expertise and over a century of experience in financial markets. Learn more at moodys.com . At Moody's, we're taking action. We're hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We're educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Job Description: The candidate will be part of the Premium Cards Product Marketing team responsible for supporting the team in marketing campaigns and product management. Responsibilities includes: Marketing campaigns and event activations Conceptualize, plan and execute marketing campaigns and event activations to deliver product revenue growth, market share growth and product profitability improvements. Oversee events activations - includes liaising with agencies, vendors, external partners, merchant's venue, planning, on-site support and overseeing full event logistics to ensure seamless execution event. Product management support Working with partners to launch partnerships and alliances with merchants and service providers. Track and drive improvement to key metrics like product acquisition and usage, customer satisfaction and post-analysis of events / marketing campaigns. Conduct research, perform analysis to provide insights and recommendations to solve business issues (e.g.. slower than forecast growth rate etc.) and meet business KPIs. Resourcefully and calmly handle any issues and troubleshoot any unexpected situations on the event day. Provide regular reporting to the senior management Implement and manage product processes to ensure compliance to brand requirements and maximum efficiency between teams and internal stakeholders Administrative support Support in managing inquiries and feedback from concierge and customer service, including investigation of feedback related to promotions held by the team, fulfillment / replacement of vouchers etc. Support in management of team budget and book-keeping - dealing effectively and punctually with any incoming invoices and outgoing bill payments, monitors invoices and expense reports. Assist the team in logistic management, including stock take Required skills: Degree holder in marketing, communication, or another related field. At least 2-3 years of relevant working experience in the marketing role Good to have exposure in the Cards industry Versatile as a team player and individual contributor, independent and has excellent work ethics and integrity. Individual should also have a respect for deadlines without compensating on quality of work. Meticulous and attention to details Ability to work with and communicate clearly with people from all levels. Possess excellent project management skills with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects, campaigns and / or events simultaneously. Poised, proactive, extremely detail-oriented with a creative streak to bring fresh perspectives to the portfolio. Assertive and driven individual with persistence and will to succeed. Good problem-solving skills - approaches problems with a rational, solution-oriented mindset and the ability to exercise logic and good judgment to provide the appropriate outcome. Adaptable, resourceful and can shift priorities quickly in a fast-paced environment. Experience in marketing to affluent segments is a big plus. Tech lead of Data Protection Company Profile Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. We advise, originate, trade, manage and distribute capital for governments, institutions and individuals. As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. We provide you a superior foundation for building a professional career where you can learn, achieve and grow. Department Profile The mission of TECHNOLOGY & OPERATIONS RISK is to deliver first-line defenses to manage risks to Firm technology, information and cyber threats through risk identification, control management and assurance. This allows the business to operate and grow in a secure and legally compliant manner. Our vision is to deliver Programs that protect and enable the business, ensure secure delivery of services to our clients, adjust to address the risks presented by an evolving threat landscape, meet regulatory expectations, and offer highly attractive career opportunities. The Enterprise Security Platforms (ESP) team is - amongst other things - responsible for developing and engineering the Firm's core security controls. The technology and solution stack spans all Firm employees as well as external clients of the Institutional Security and Wealth Management Businesses. It consists of home-grown software, 3rd party software, open source products, appliances, and auxiliary services and solutions. We are looking for highly skilled programmers with experience building applications in Java. Java Developers are responsible for analyzing user requirements and business objectives, determining application features and functionality, and recommending changes to existing Java-based applications, among other duties. Senior Developer of Data Protection needs to compile detailed technical documentation and user assistance material, requiring excellent oral/written communication. The candidate will be part of the global team with global responsibilities of the below: Responsibilities: Analyze communicated requirements and come up with tech design Research, develop tech solutions based on communicated requirements and tech design Enhance existing ESP security solutions prioritized based on client feedback, issues on PROD, internal discussion etc. Create automated testing for the solutions developed Create documentation/support procedures and assist operation/SRE team for operational work. Enforce software SLDC in the development circle Support continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and technologies and presenting these for architectural review

See job description for details We have a great opportunity for a talented and self-motivated Business Analyst to join our Business Application Service team at NCS. At NCS, we seek to nurture talents in creating and developing innovative solutions. If you are passionate about new technologies and new ideas, NCS could be a place for you! The Business Analyst will be the vital link between our customer and development team to gather and translate the business requirement and ensuring the successful completion of analytical, building, testing and deployment tasks of the system. Roles & Responsibilities Define configuration specifications. Define business analysis requirements. Define reporting and alerting requirements. Elicit requirements when appropriate. Translate and simplify requirements. Manage communication in relation to requirements. Requirement analysis. Plan and monitor business cases. Perform quality assurance. Develop relationships with partners. Design and review test cases. Process change requests. Assist in the design, documentation, and maintenance of system processes. Report on technical issues and questions, make recommendations to development team. Communicate key insights to stakeholders, facilitators, and partners. Constantly be on the lookout for ways to improve business practices and efficiencies. The ideal profile should A degree in IT / Computer Science. Previous 3-5 years of proven work experience in Business Analysis must be able to read Java source code must be able to read and write SQL (can be any database, e.g. Oracle, MSSQL, etc) Proven experience in eliciting requirements and testing on government application Experience in creating application prototypes and mockups. Experience in analyzing data to draw business-relevant conclusions and in data visualization techniques and tools Skillful in Critical Thinking and problem solving proficiency. Good knowledge in generating process documentation Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills

Introduction We are expanding our Fab Operations and are looking for Equipment Engineers, In this role you will plan and implement effective preventive maintenance programs, monitor and control equipment performance indices and involve in various continuous improvement programs to drive optimization efforts across the organization. Module : Clean Tech To uphold the equipment key indices as per module requirement To continuously improve the equipment performance through resolution of chronic and sporadic issues To ensure that the equipment knowledge is maintained and archived To uphold 6S Your Job: To own, maintain and improve the following indices: Quality, Uptime and Cost Sustain equipment KPI and make continuous improvements to enhance the performance Monitor and control equipment performance indices. Tech lead of Vulnerability Management Company Profile Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. We advise, originate, trade, manage and distribute capital for governments, institutions and individuals. As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. We provide you a superior foundation for building a professional career where you can learn, achieve and grow. Department Profile The mission of TECHNOLOGY & OPERATIONS RISK is to deliver first-line defenses to manage risks to Firm technology, information and cyber threats through risk identification, control management and assurance. This allows the business to operate and grow in a secure and legally compliant manner. Our vision is to deliver Programs that protect and enable the business, ensure secure delivery of services to our clients, adjust to address the risks presented by an evolving threat landscape, meet regulatory expectations, and offer highly attractive career opportunities. The Enterprise Security Platforms (ESP) team is - amongst other things - responsible for developing and engineering the Firm's core security controls. The technology and solution stack spans all Firm employees as well as external clients of the Institutional Security and Wealth Management Businesses. It consists of home-grown software, 3rd party software, open source products, appliances, and auxiliary services and solutions. We are looking for highly skilled programmers with experience building applications in Java. Java Developers are responsible for analyzing user requirements and business objectives, determining application features and functionality, and recommending changes to existing Java-based applications, among other duties. Java Developers need to compile detailed technical documentation and user assistance material, requiring excellent oral/written communication. The candidate will be part of the global team with global responsibilities of the below: Responsibilities: Analyze communicated requirements and come up with tech design Research, develop tech solutions based on communicated requirements and tech design Enhance existing ESP security solutions prioritized based on client feedback, issues on PROD, internal discussion etc. Create automated testing for the solutions developed Create documentation/support procedures and assist operation/SRE team for operational work. Enforce software SLDC in the development circle Support continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and technologies and presenting these for architectural review

Job_Title: Global Markets Operations, Collateral & Valuation Operations, Analyst, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Global Markets Operations, Collateral & Valuation Operations, Analyst, Singapore JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Daily tasks include, but are not limited to: Daily monitoring of client portfolios, issuing & receiving collateral calls to ensure the extensive interaction with Clients Resolution and escalation of all client disputes and regulatory queries New client on-boarding Liaison with internal groups (Credit, Sales, Trading, Middle office, Legal, Front Office, Settlements, and Corporate Treasury) to resolve collateral issues. Reconciliation of portfolios Collateral Optimization Monthly Interest and coupon settlement Performing a number of control functions, ensuring the integrity of our processes. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: Ability to generate creative solutions to problems and challenge processes; be willing to dig into the detail to resolve issues Some experience of portfolio reconciliations and processing of margin calls would be desirable Confidence to interact with external clients Strong organizational skills and the ability to cope with rapidly changing priorities throughout the day are essential Familiarity with/ability to learn Excel macros and other functions PREFFERED QUALIFICATIONS: Functional Expertise - Keeps up-to-date with emerging business, economic, and market trends Technical Skills - Demonstrates strong technical skills required for the role, pays attention to detail, takes initiative to broaden his/ her knowledge and demonstrates appropriate financial/analytical skills Client and Business Focus - Effectively handles difficult requests, builds trusting, long term relationships with clients, helps the client to identify/define needs and manages client/business expectations Our core value is building strong relationships with our institutional clients, which include corporations, financial service providers, and fund managers. We help them buy and sell financial products on exchanges around the world, raise funding, and manage risk. This is a dynamic, entrepreneurial team with a passion for the markets, with individuals who thrive in fast-paced, changing environments and are energized by a bustling trading floor. ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world. We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers. We're committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Responsibilities Modernise and produce enterprise-level solutions for IT Workplace which includes laptops, desktops, tablets and mobile devices. Create and customise IT Workplace solutions that are scalable, adaptable and support the ever-changing business needs. Support escalation for application support and troubleshooting, provides guidance and direction in resolution of escalated issues and/or complex production, application or system problems. Provide subject matter expert advice for complex issues related to Microsoft, VMWare, Citrix, and other key software tools used in IT Workplace. Maintain system documentation for domain technologies, including installation, configuration, and appropriate SOPs before handing over to IT Workplace Operation teams. Improve and enhance existing processes on recurring problems, existing solutions or documentation. Provide training to team members to drive innovation and operational excellence. Manage customer satisfaction and expectations through effective communication. Implement new IT Workplace solutions by engaging both internal and external teams/vendors. Oversee project deliverables related to IT Workplace Services and ensure that it adheres to standards and policies. Work closely with architecture and strategy teams to define IT Workplace technology architecture. Work closely with operations teams to ensure smooth day-2 operationalisation of any technology implementation. Develop and document standards, security procedures, and controls for access to ensure integrity of the Windows Systems, Active Directory, and related systems Requirements Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Electronics Engineering or equivalent. Min. 10 years of experience working with Microsoft technologies (including Windows OS, Active Directory, Windows File Services, and Group Policies, Intune, Autopilot, Office365, Microsoft Authenticator), Citrix and VMWare in a competitive IT environment serving more than 5000 end-users. Deep and thorough understanding of monitoring best practices, and compliance to best practices for security and operations. Proven track record on deploying and managing multiple Windows Active Directory Forests and Domains 2008/2012/2016/2019 and Azure AD. Good knowledge of AD, ADFS, PKI in Windows Servers, DNS, DHCP, WINS, DFS, Microsoft enterprise technology, VDI and any remote access technology. Good knowledge on Azure Active Directory Connect synchronization services, Active Directory Federation Service and File and Print services, Citrix and VMWare services. Good knowledge on Group Policy, AD Trusts, AD Sites and Services, DNS, DHCP and DFS. Good Working knowledge authentication protocols such as Multi-Factor, NTLM, Kerberos, SAML(SSO) and AP. Good working knowledge on Windows 10/Endpoint/Email/Gateway DLP and Security, Encryption, Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), Client/Mobile Device Patching and Proxy technologies. Experience in managing other technologies such as internet proxy and end point protection product suites such as MS Defender/MCAS

Job_Descriptions: About Schlumberger: We are Schlumberger, the leading provider of technology and services to the energy industry. We define the boundaries of the industry by unleashing our talented people's energy. We are looking for innovators to join our diverse community of colleagues and develop new solutions and push the limits of what is possible.
