Posted by: Manisha Doogar Recruiter View profile & contact We are building our business and are looking to hire a Talent Manger in Singapore. You must be an experienced Researcher who is well networked on the candidate side; you can research and map using our in house database, Linked In and external job portals and deliver strong and relevant shortlists in a timely manner, working closely with the Consultants who manage the client relationships. You must have excellent presentation as you will be attending external meetings. This role does not involve Business Development. We are celebrating our 14-year anniversary and over this time, the company has evolved and become stronger and better positioned to meet the challenges of today’s ever changing markets. Today we have an incredibly strong focus on Work/Life Balance, and we mean it. We are a Global Boutique business . We have small teams in Singapore covering Asia and Dubai covering the Middle East. We focus on professional hires and because the markets are different in each location, they evolve differently. In APAC, we are very strong in Financial Services. In the Middle East, we have built our Insurance, Private Equity, Banking, Consulting, Retail and FMCG desks. KS is a strong company – we have structured ourselves so that our business is sustainable for the very long term; there is no waste, we focus on quality, we have never had to reduce salaries or make redundancies. We have grown organically. Because of the high delivery to our clients, our candidates never drop out, our clients are never unhappy. We cover the same space as the big recruitment firms, but we deliver to our clients in a very different way and our relationships are solid. Our businesses are fully licensed and insured. Our expectations are high… Because quality both internally and externally is very important to us. We want our team to: Live the KS brand, be proud of what we have achieved and how the company has developed Be a ‘doer’; respond to emails instantly, especially if from an external source, complete the follow up you promised Excel in all you do, if you aren’t going to do something properly, don’t do it at all Enjoy working in an environment with senior experienced peers and be proud of each other Work as a team member and help your Partners where possible, sharing leads etc. Market yourself positively in all business and personal interactions Always present in an excellent manner KS have always grown organically and our global networks have led to exciting partnerships. We are always open to speaking to recruitment professionals who are self-motivated, entrepreneurial, can work autonomously and want to be part of an experienced international team. We are an independent company and have a huge focus on work/life balance; many of our team are supporting their families and we encourage a flexible work environment so that we are happy, healthy and balanced across all that we do. All our systems are online (Bullhorn, Office 365, MS Teams) allowing us to work together from all over. Our service to our clients is exceptional and therefore our processes and attention to detail are thorough and we run a very strong back office which we have refined over the years. Please email: manisha@kstalentsolutions.com for more information.

Job_Title: Head of Communications, Corporate Affairs and Brand & Marketing (CABM), Singapore
Job_Descriptions: About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities This role is responsible for the strategy and delivery of full suite of communications for the Singapore (SG) franchise and businesses, to protect the Bank reputation, strengthen brand profile & and improve employee experiences through various channels, platforms, and partners. Strategy Provide strategic and tactical communications advice to the Singapore Management Team (MT). Proactive management of reputational risks, working in partnership with Singapore MT, Group and Asia Corporate Affairs and Brand & Marketing (CABM) peers Support the Head of CABM, Singapore in building the external profile of the Singapore franchise, Singapore Chief Executive Officer (CEO), Singapore MT and the Bank and businesses - including the proactive identification of opportunities for external profiling. Identify opportunities which directly support business operations and the achievement of business goals. Responsible for managing client communications, in partnership with the businesses, and Group and Asia Communications teams Key Stakeholders Internal Country / Regional level: Singapore CEO Singapore Management Team (MT) Key business and function leads (including support functions) Asia CABM Head and Asia Communications Head Country CABM and Communications heads in ASEAN cluster markets (Malaysia, Thailand and Vietnam) Group level: Group Internal Comms and Culture Comms teams Group Executive Comms and Strategic Media, Content & Campaigns, Reputation & Issues Management Heads Strategic Comms Partners - Corporate, Commercial & Institutional Banking (CCIB), Consumer, Private and Business Banking (CPBB), Employee Comms, Function comms External Media editors and journalists (local media, key online influencers) Agency partners (social media, etc) Other vendors Other Responsibilities Develop, implement and evaluate the annual Singapore communications plan (covering strategic and executive communications, business communications, financial reporting, employer branding, sustainability and community investment) Build both external and internal profile of the Singapore CEO, Business and Function Heads, with a focus on strategy, business capabilities and achievements, thought leadership, management expertise, community initiatives and people engagement events. Maintain control of issues that have the potential to cause reputational damage to the Bank. Manage crises and proactively deal with threats to the Bank's reputation. Identify communication opportunities to build internal awareness and pride; and manage relationships with the media to secure strategic interviews during critical corporate milestones. Develop and pro-actively pitch op-eds and story idea/s to the media that fit the Bank's strategic agenda. Develop and maintain key message documents and maintain key data points that back up the Bank's strategic corporate plan. Ensure compliance with the Bank's communications Standards and Policies in-country. Work with Group and Asia communications teams and key stakeholders to ensure coordinated approach to communications, as well as consistency in delivery for quality outcomes Use new technologies to deliver better and more targeted content with greater audience segmentation, both internally and externally. Drive an insights-driven and measurement focused approach that sets clear objectives, metrics and measures key results for all initiatives to assess impact of our efforts and drive a continuous improvement approach. Our Ideal Candidate Functional Knowledge & Experience A communications expert with at 15+ years in an external and internal communications role in a financial institution or international conglomerate At least a bachelor's degree in a communication or business-related discipline Experience in driving external and internal communications strategies Experience in managing teams Excellent working knowledge of media including deadlines, interests, agendas, etc. Excellent relationships with the media at all levels Skills Ability to analyse sentiments and customise communications according to target audience; and effectively communicate complex ideas to diverse audiences Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to provide sound and credible strategic advice, and constructive challenge to senior executives Strong people management and relationship building skills Ability to operate with the highest integrity and discretion Critical thinking skills to exercise judgement and continuously looking for better and more effective ways of working Collaborative and able to encourage creativity, generate new ideas for effective implementation of business solutions Ability to think on their feet and to respond calmly and effectively in high-pressure situations or environment Possess excellent communication and presentation skills as well as in planning and organisation Ability to lead and guide in the design, development of multi-channel communications campaigns, and championing the use of innovative communications vehicles and practices Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Team Overview The Market Data Services team is a specialist data content and commercial management function which provides industry-leading guidance and support for the acquisition, provisioning and governance of financial data to all areas of the firm globally. Our mandate is to ensure we operate best practice standards in the maintenance and supply of Market Data. With a diverse user-base comes immensely varied requirements for data and we support these needs by utilising the subject matter expertise and financial knowledge that our team is expected to demonstrate. Who we're looking for You will have a strong background in all aspects of Market Data but with notably strong commercial negotiation skills and a good knowledge of compliance ideally from an Investment Management background. You will be working as part of a very experienced and supportive team who are based in London. You will be heading up Market Data in Singapore for the APAC region with currently 1 existing member of staff taking responsibility for Business Services for the region. What you'll do You will have a good knowledge of Market Data operations with specific relevance to activities within an investment management company. Commercial Management will require undertaking demand challenges with vendors as well as internal business groups to ensure effective cost-control, identification of saving opportunities and the consolidation/rationalisation of products within our supply chain. You will identify key stakeholders to determine market data business requirements and you will be required to support the business by drafting contracts and negotiating the commercials with our service providers. The function will simultaneously need to provide suitable compliance oversight to ensure adherence to vendor terms and conditions. This will require significant interaction with internal groups to educate and manage operating behaviours. Key workflows for this function within Market Data include: Global engagement for vendor management in-line with the firms ongoing needs Facilitation of BAU requests for services through demand management and Techlink Oversight for regional entitlements and user permissioning, handled by Business Services Product utilisations with users and providers Contract and vendor management Responsible for vendor reporting and declaration requirements Monthly processes - month-end checks, inventory preparation, due diligence Commercial oversight for contractual obligations around subscriptions and usage Efficiency based optimisation of user needs and vendor services Represent Market Data within Project groups where appropriate Engagement with business requestors on new requirements and existing renewals Regional ownership for our index request process Key Responsibilities Engagement with the BAU process of ordering data, including the process for indices Oversee APAC invoice management and inventory reconciliation processes in line with London procedures Process regional Techlink requests for service fulfilment Manage the contract renewals process through pipeline tracking and interaction with our Legal team Vendor liaison as the owner of the commercial relationships with our providers Support for service enablement and escalation point for service and vendor issues Advising potential & existing users and stakeholders about vendor policies and market data license restrictions Consultancy expertise to users / project teams at the contract level with regards to data usage and licensing Understanding and validating technical controls and system usage Monitoring of application data consumption, where required Responsible for recharge methodology Key liaison to Legal as part of the commercial review process Inventory updates and maintenance of contracts records Essential Skills A proven track record in Market Data, with strong experience in Market Data commercials, negotiations, business services and compliance Good knowledge of Investment Management - what we do as a firm/how we make money Experience of working with vendors at both a strategic and tactical level, including Bloomberg, Factset, Refinitiv, ICE Data Services, FTSE Russell and MSCI Experience of market data systems such as FITS, DART, DACS Excellent communication and relationship skills Attention to detail and a flexible attitude Able to work to tight deadlines, particularly in relation to diarised processes Strong MS-Office skills, especially Excel Schroders is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications regardless of sex, marital status, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, religious belief or age. .

Job_Title: Senior VP, Compliance Audit, Group Audit
Job_Descriptions: Senior VP, Compliance Audit, Group Audit Posting Date: 26-Jan-2022 Location: Raffles Place, Singapore, SG Company: United Overseas Bank Limited About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand and Vietnam, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Audit function is an independent internal audit team that provides objective assurance and consulting to improve and add value to the Group's operations. We help the Group achieve its strategic objectives by adopting a systematic and disciplined approach towards evaluating and improving the effectiveness of risk management, control and governance processes. Job Responsibilities You will lead audit projects and be responsible for the audits of Group Compliance. A sound knowledge as well as familiarity with AML laws and regulatory requirements governing the businesses are essential. The team will perform different types of audits such as global, thematic or business portfolio audits of the Bank's Head Office Operations as well as its regional subsidiaries and overseas branches. You are responsible for the internal audits including the preparation of an audit plan, scheduling and assigning work, estimating resource needs and finalizing of audit reports . You should be well-versed in assessing risks and controls; recommend business-focused solutions to improve risk management practices; as well as play an advisory role as subject matter expert. You will prepare concise summarized reports and management papers for Audit Committees and other stakeholders. You will also support the Division Head in driving and executing strategic priorities and engagement with key stakeholders. Job Requirements A recognized degree, with minimum 15 years of relevant working experience either in reputable auditing firms or financial institutions. Professional certifications such as CIA, CFA, ACAMS or CPA are added advantages. Strong experience in risk and controls management, and an excellent working knowledge of compliance and conduct. Proven track record in managing or assessing AML/CFT controls Experience with data analytics to enhance quality of audit is preferred. Able to multi-task and cope with change and diversity in a fast-paced environment. Ability to think objectively and "think outside the box" when analyzing issues. Possess a strong analytical and problem solving skills with excellent verbal / written communication and interpersonal skills. Possess strong project management skills to lead audit assignments. Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. Job_Title: AVP, Group Regulatory Compliance (Group Oversight & Corporate Functions)
Job_Descriptions: OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world's most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody's. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World's Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Division Description Group Legal & Compliance (GLC) Division supports the Bank in all legal, regulatory and compliance matters. The division ensures that the Bank's businesses comply with policies, procedures and relevant laws, rules and regulations issued by Monetary Authority of Singapore and other local regulators. Apart from being a legal advisor on litigation, trademark filings and other legality issues where relevant, GLC plays an important role as undertakers of the bank-wide regulatory compliance and anti-money laundering initiatives. This includes developing policies and procedures to manage and mitigate risks relating to money laundering and financing of terrorism, as well as monitoring, detection and combating of money laundering and financial crime activities. Key Responsibilities Provide regulatory compliance advice to businesses and support functions assigned. Provide advisory support on cross-border marketing guidelines to businesses in the bank or group entities engaging in cross-border activities. Keep abreast of new and changes to regulations. Drive the implementation of new regulatory requirements. Manage breach reporting process and track completion of rectification actions. Maintain the library of regulations and its relevance to the relevant functions. Act as the liaison with regulators on regulatory compliance matters. Act as the liaison with external counsels and consultations in respect of local regulatory requirements and permissible cross-border activities to formulate new and review existing cross-border marketing guidelines Manage projects assigned. Provide regulatory compliance training. Collate FATCA and CRS reports and other regulatory reports for submission to regulator. Collate and track regulatory developments and significant issues of subsidiaries and international offices. Review regulatory compliance policies and procedures of the bank, international offices and subsidiaries. Manage and track progress of the Group's Annual Compliance Plans. Support division in preparation of senior management and CRAFT reporting Track completion of department tasks. Qualifications The ideal Candidate will meet the following requirements: Possess a university degree. 3-5 years of relevant experience in regulatory compliance in a bank or external audit focusing on audit of financial institutions. Familiar with MAS regulations, FATCA, CRS, Volcker Rule and/ or cross border marketing requirements would be an advantage. Familiar with financial products and services. Proven leadership, organization and facilitation skills. Good interpersonal and communication skills. Proactive, independent and resourceful. Embodies team work. Ability to adapt to changes. Ability to work under time constraint and pressure. At OCBC, we recognise your drive, passion and talent. We will bring out the best in you and empower you to excel. Fulfil your life goals and career ambitions with us. *We regret that only shortlisted Candidates will be notified.

The ideal candidate will be a storyteller who understand market needs, working collaboratively with sales, marketing, and other key stakeholders to translate technical features of global transaction services solutions into inspiring product positioning, messaging, and value proposition. Job Duties & Responsibilities Create a content strategy and messaging framework to ensure sales content copy is aligned with brand & customer voice with compelling Calls-to-Action Craft and write case studies with customer stories that explain the business problem, the solution architecture that solved it (including explanations with diagrams), and its benefits. Craft the language of sales content & FAQs in RFP library, co-create persuasive & compelling positioning & messaging for RfP proposal during storyboard sessions with bid / proposal team members and key stakeholders & deliver completed written proposal responses with subject matter experts Work closely with our marketing communications and sales team to craft and review award entries Identify and re-work existing written content where relevant Conduct market & competitive benchmarking, and engage sales, product, and marketing leadership teams to deliver the sales enablement content Manage the continuous improvement in content development to ensure quality and improve client engagements Minimum Requirements Education / Preferred Qualifications University-level Bachelor's degree in communications, marketing, banking or related discipline 3-5 years of relevant work experience Experience selling B2B solutions (added advantage) Knowledge and Skills Strong writing, editing, proofreading skills and experience in creating, adapting, and unifying content Ability in storytelling with a passion for using creative imagery to communicate Ability to understand and translate complex concepts into clear, concise, and impactful communications Strong MS Office Skills (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint) Critical thinker, creative problem solver with keen attention to detail & quality Ability to operate in a multi-tasking environment, meet deadlines Self-motivated; highly driven to produce results. Strong team player with good communication and interpersonal skills Ability to collaborate with many different teams and personalities Ability to influence and impact outcomes Knowledge of sales methodologies, sales process, and buyer's journey alignment (added advantage) Knowledge of Global Transaction Services (added advantage) Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

About Swiss Re Swiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. We cover both Property & Casualty and Life & Health. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world. Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work. About the Team and Role: Swiss Re continues to enhance the Corporate Real Estate & Services (CRES) functions to better align with business needs in the region and global operating model. As Head Safety & Physical Security you will establish strategic objectives and accompanying operational plans that effectively mitigate physical security and life safety risks across the APAC Region. You will work on a wide variety of real estate related operations, projects and initiatives across Swiss Re's business units. As a seasoned security professional, you will support the Head CRES APAC in creating and developing an environment of continuous improvement and professionalism in interacting with our stakeholders, CRES Regional Service Representatives (RSR's) for Safety & Security in Zurich, EMEA and the Americas as well as with team members across Swiss Re and external partners. A solid discipline of operational excellence is required for this role to support the leadership and management of the CRES portfolio across a number of operational workstreams in line with the CRES service strategy. Responsibilities As Regional Service Representative (RSR) for Safety & Security (S&S) this role is responsible for service delivery/ operations. Collaborate with various CRES colleagues (local, regional and global) to; Co-ordinate, monitor and report on all processes associated with protection goals of Swiss Re and the global S&S concept Ensure the professional integration and execution of S&S processes Drive and support the incident management process Participate on projects (construction, strategy etc) to ensure the design and S&S protocols are adhered to the CRES office designs and test/ monitor implementation stages Develop and maintain a good working relationship with your counterpart RSR's in Zurich, EMEA and Americas. Together; >  Develop and maintain the service strategy on relevant reports, statistics, brochures, guidelines and training materials for S&S operations >  Develop new training programs for CRES and Swiss Re employees that align to Swiss Re's policies and standards Collaborate with the Group Security Manager APAC on intelligence reviews and its strategy/ policy Build and maintain working relationships by supporting the Local Safety & Security Officers (LSSO) with training, LSSO tasks, and ensure standards set out for the location are aligned with Swiss Re policies and standards Collaborate with Building Technology representatives to ensure coordination of maintenance of systems that impact S&S at locations Access Management Manage and monitor the visitor (internal and external) management process Manage and monitor the administration of physical building access in the region Ensure location team report the malfunction and any system issues to the respective department in a timely manner Lead investigations that are found to have breached the S&S of locations Safety Operations Ensure Occupational Health and Safety (OH&S) is in line with internal standards, checks and compliant with local statutory regulations. Support preliminary investigations associated with OH&S incidents. Security Operations Management oversight of all security systems infrastructure (access control, video surveillance, intrusion detection) and associated operational procedures and standards when appropriate. Management oversight of any security officers or guards as appropriate Applying global guidelines, triage and co-ordinate with LSSO security operations for conference & events hosted at locations Conduct preliminary investigations associated with loss and theft of property, coordinate with the specialised compliance unit. Relationship Management Work closely with internal and external divisions, employees and companies Maintain good working relationships with official bodies, authorities, security industry peers, companies and suppliers. About You: Knowledge of Security Systems including Access Control, CCTV and intruder-based alarms is essential Experience of assessing Safety and Security risks of offices and their locations Experience of manned guarding principles Bachelor's degree is an advantage but not mandatory Minimum 8 years real estate, facility and/or security operations management experience required Minimum 5 years supervisory experience required and working knowledge and/or certification with OHS standards in at least two APAC countries regulations Demonstrable experience building customer relationships and creating solutions within a matrix organisation Possess leadership and management skills essential in guiding teams and ability to engage, influence and inspire staff Strong knowledge of corporate security protocols and standards Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English including strong presentation skills; ability to write professional documents in a clear, concise manner Proficient in MS Word, PowerPoint and Excel Travel Requirements •    This position requires some domestic and international travel for meetings and training. Job_Title: Threat Fusion Program Intelligence Analyst - Corporate Security
Job_Descriptions: The Position The Corporate Security (CorpSec) organization advances the overall state of security for Twitter employees and work environments. The virtual Threat Fusion Center is a global program that ingests, analyzes, and integrates intelligence from various sources to provide its cross functional partners and leadership with a nuanced view of Twitter’s global threat landscape. Reporting to the Threat Fusion Program Manager, you will collaborate with global teams to understand intelligence requirements and present key insights in support of stakeholders. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of the space that straddles physical and cyber security while analyzing advanced and hybrid threats. You will leverage technical/cybersecurity fluency to add nuance to the Threat Fusion Center’s all source intelligence cycle. Key partners in this process include Twitter’s Information Security, Site Integrity and User Services teams. This position is ideal for someone with 2-5 years of prior intelligence analysis experience with comfort analyzing the cyber, physical and geopolitical domains. Help us achieve a strategic priority by supporting a program that enhances adversarial defence across Twitter. What You’ll Do Intelligence Fusion Collect, analyze, and prepare all-source threat information/data and intelligence fusion across multiple domains and vectors of approach Support threat actor mapping initiatives across the physical, cyber and other domains Develop and maintain intelligence products and initiatives in response to evolving geopolitical incidents Engage in a data-driven approach to proactive intelligence analysis and production Rapidly communicate emerging incidents and crises to program management Support the program manager by delivering briefings tailored to key stakeholders Regularly meet with program partners to discuss relevant threats and requirements Stay current with trends, analytical techniques, tools, and tradecraft Ethos Work collaboratively to develop strong customer relationships with key partners internally and externally Support opportunities to enhance and evolve the program with a learning mindset and proactive, future looking mentality Qualifications Written and verbal fluency in English BA or BS degree in Security/Intelligence Studies, Political Science, International Relations, Cyber Security or a related field Prior threat or business intelligence experience (private or public sector) with technical or non-technical subject matter expertise in cybersecurity Ability to synthesize and clearly communicate complex findings, focusing on critical issues and actionable opportunities Analytically minded with a strong working knowledge of risks, vulnerabilities, and threats Dedicated and creative mindset; possesses the ability to harness original concepts into successful solutions Background in a fast paced environment where 24/7 availability is required Excellent interpersonal, verbal, presentation, and written communication skills, with ability to effectively present to a wide range of audiences Self-starter, proactive and team player Willingness and ability to travel Nice to have: Fluency in Russian, Japanese, Mandarin, or Arabic Previous experience in the technology/social media industry Company Description Twitter serves the public conversation by encouraging people all over the world to connect, learn, debate, and solve problems together. We believe conversation can change the world, and that’s why Tweeps (that’s what we call Twitter employees) come to work every day. Additional Information We are committed to an inclusive and diverse Twitter. Twitter is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.

Job_Title: Associate Director, CCIB Client Coverage Analytics
Job_Descriptions: Associate Director, CCIB Client Coverage Analytics About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Be an internal analytics consultant for CCIB Client Coverage and develop useful analytics products across use cases, segments, and product portfolios Build compelling analytics products using industry leading analytics tools such as Tableau, Alteryx, driving use cases across data monetization, risk mitigation, productivity improvement Automate business and operation workflows using automation tools such as Newgen and RPA, simplifying complex processes and enhancing productivity across the organization Translate key challenges, requirements and needs from the business into impactful, actionable metric, KPIs and solutions, to solve everyday business problems Assess key market trends, gaps, and opportunities to onboard new innovative technologies Partner with stakeholders and senior management to build awareness and expand the analytics/automation offering of the team, aligning with business needs for today and the future Build trust and strong working relationships with business and technology stakeholders Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Lead to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank's Conduct Principles : Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Financial Markets; Financial Crime Compliance; The Right Environment. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Key Stakeholders IMO Performance Improvement Team CCIB Technology / EDMp database team Client Coverage COO team Client Lifecycle Design & Management (CLDM) team IMO Management Team Our Ideal Candidate A proven track record with 6+ years of relevant analytics work experience and demonstrated career progression/increase in responsibilities Strong academic record: Degree in Finance, Statistics, Computer Science or related field Strong Knowledge of Tableau or similar visualization tools Knowledge of either SAS, Alteryx, R or Python Proficient in SQL Strong understanding of Hadoop Database Knowledge in modern data storage and advanced analytics technologies such as Dremio, Snowflake, NLP, OCR, Computer Vision will be hugely beneficial Understanding in emerging cloud and smart technologies such as Azure, AWS, Cognitive Automation will be an added plus Experience in data commercialization - facilitating partnerships and driving buy-in/adoption from stakeholders of varying levels Understanding of the ETL process Good presentation, time management, negotiation and influencing skills Strong analytical and problem solving skills Experience in project management from business requirement definition, solution validation, user testing, technical documentation and production roll out Ability to manage multiple work streams with strong problem solving and analytical skills Strong communication and presentation skills to varying levels of management Highly driven and motivated with an eager-to-learn attitude and actively seek out ways to improve processes, people, and products Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

My client is a global bank and they are looking for a Business Analyst. 1 Top 3 Must have skills (in terms of skills, qualifications, interpersonal, certification soft skills) * Knowledge in FM product (FX, derivatives minimum) * Trade lifecycle understanding of at least 2 products * Xml, SQL * STP - straight through processing Top 3 MUST HAVE skills (in terms of skills, qualifications, interpersonal, certification soft skills) Knowledge in FM product (FX, derivatives minimum) Trade lifecycle understanding of at least 2 products Xml, SQL STP - straight through processing RESPONSIBILITIES JOB SCOPE It is also the central data repository for all Financial Markets transactions providing information for regulatory and non-regulatory reporting purposes. The current investments into the platform sponsor the following objectives: Complete the adoption of SABRE generated risks and valuation for all official purposes across Market Risk, Finance and Operations Expand the use of the platform beyond Financial Markets Meet regulatory objectives such as the Fundamental Review of the Trading Book (FRTB), the transition from IBOR to Risk Free Rates and multiple regulatory transaction reporting changes (MIFID II, SFTR, SEC, MAR, CFTC and EMIR re-writes) Build the core trade Booking and Life-cycling functionality as part of the FM re-platforming initiative, aiming at migrating all Transaction Processing onto our strategic in-house platform, with SABRE at its core This role involves extending the SABRE Trade Lake which is a core component of the platform, to build a future-proof trade store solution meeting on-going regulatory projects requirements, as well as enabling the strategic aim of reducing point to point connections and reliance on fragmented legacy systems, and supporting advanced Analytics on FM Trade data. In-flight work on the platform includes: Extension of the current data model (FpML) to support new use cases Extension of the Trade Lake API supporting high performance querying on a Business data dictionary of trade attributes, enabling quick turnaround of business benefits through self-service data extraction capability Support for direct Trade Booking and Life-Cycling within the SABRE Application Formulate and transition the Trade Lake control framework into BAU On-going remediation of data accuracy and data completeness gaps Supporting other project / reporting demands (MiFID2, SFTR, SEC, MAR, Securities Settlements, etc…) JOB PURPOSE Building strong, effective relationships with both the business and technology teams, across global offices. Collaborating with trade platform teams, project teams and control functions to gather requirements, solve business problems by proposing relevant, innovative solutions Working across Trade Processing platforms (S2BX, Murex3.1, Murex2.11, BTS, Sophis, Apex, Wealth Management platforms) Working as part of an agile team including Business Analysts, Developers and Testers and being able to identify business implications of technical design decisions and influence them accordingly. Being a creative source of proposals and channelling user aspiration towards sustainable and future proof solutions Deliver functional consistency across the various projects by influencing architecture and design decisions Translating and documenting business requirements Working across asset classes of FX, ALM, Rates, Credits and Commodities KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Understand user requirements and study the feasibility. Propose solutions that align to the strategic roadmap. Cleary document and agree on assumptions, shortfalls and timelines to resolve the known constraints and dependencies. Pro-actively highlight risk and issues. Engage, manage and build strong relationships with both business and technology stakeholders Translate solutions into detailed, unambiguous, business and functional requirements Ensure the overall quality of business requirements, functional specifications and other supporting documents meet the bank's standards Work proactively with fellow BAs and other team members, ensuring work is proportionally distributed and targets are met Ensure documents such as functional specs support the development of practical technology solutions and suitable test cases Work as part of a combined cross-functional agile team and support the on-going build as required e.g. drafting/reviewing of test cases, closing out developers open issues/questions, contributing to solution design etc… Assist the business with UAT, including communication, planning, preparation and test case preparation Identify risks and issues early, plan mitigating steps and communicate these to PMs and business stakeholders in a timely manner Work closely with project and programme managers to ensure stakeholders are fully engaged and expectations managed SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS Delivery focused, committing to specific tasks and ensuring these and the overall projects deadlines are met General Skills: Extensive product knowledge across asset classes encompassing product & trade life cycle (pricing and risk is good to have). (Regulatory like MIFID II, EMIR, SEC exposure is a plus) Experience working on vendor systems (eCommerce platforms, Murex, BTS, Apex, Sophis, S2BX, Wealth systems) Ability to work proactively, independently and displays strong initiative Pragmatic team player with an attention to detail. Ability to accurately translate and document business needs into functional requirements and produce quality documentation Ability to drive multiple agenda and effectively manage priorities Strong communication and presentation skills with an excellent standard of English (written and spoken) Technical Knowledge Good understanding of the FO to BO trade flow of financial products, including Middle Office, Operations and Finance activities Experience working in big data solutions and data querying tools. Experience in (ES) elastic search is a plus. Strong understanding of key technology concepts, basics in SQL, NoSQL, functional programming and architecture. Strong technical acumen is a big plus. Experience implementing trade STP having multiple source platforms. FpML knowledge, ISDA CDM standards is a plus. Preferred Domain Knowledge 8+ years of relevant experience in full end to end financial markets project delivery life cycle Other Preferred Skills Strong interpersonal, problem solving and analytical skills Multicultural awareness Displays personal authority, integrity and ethics Huxley is a trading division of SThree Pte Limited (Registration Number: 200720126E | SThree Pte Limited Licence Number 16S8216 | Huxley Licence Number 53132076J) Award winner of: Recruitment Agency of the Year by Asia Recruitment Awards 2019 | Best Client Services by Asia Recruitment Awards 2017 | Best Overseas Operation by Global Recruiters 2017 | Highly Commended for Best Large Recruitment Business 2017 | Commended for Best In-House Training by Global Recruiters 2017

Job_Title: Network Production Services Lead - 1 Year Contract
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Irfana Farhath Recruiter View profile & contact The Position is responsible for assisting in both Event and Incident management focusing on the network infrastructure connecting from the front-end web services and applications right to the backend mainframes and databases. This highly visible and critical position of the bank’s client facing platforms covers 24x7 network event monitoring. Partnering with other subject matter experts on customer impacting issues that arise. Ensure the issue is triaged and addressed promptly and mitigated or resolved in the quickest and most efficient manner, to minimize impact to our customers. Post an incident, perform initial root cause analysis, identifying potential gaps and opportunities. Key Responsibilities • Event monitoring of networking components ranging from Cisco switches /F5 Loadbalancer / Firewalls / Proxies / DNS • Provide support during change windows, validation and certification of change completion • Engagement & triage for network related issues, or assist in isolation of issues at the application layer relating to response times, connectivity etc. • Proactively reaching out to understand connectivity and interdependency between applications and the network components between • Value add through gaining a strong end to end knowledge and understanding of the infrastructure. To eventually possess the ability to dive deeply when activated without the need to ask for specific source/destination to start with, but by just the application name. • Communicate with various audiences leaders regarding network related issues. Possess the ability to drive a call and bring an issue to a mitigated point • Participate in post incident review for high impacting network related issues. Assist in the follow-up and potential permanent fixes with the respective teams/vendors • Fast paced team environment, ability to work independently under highly stressful situations and yet think logically to work around the problem is essential Key Requirements • Position requires demonstrated actual hands on experience troubleshooting production related issues on Cisco Network devices, F5 loadbalancers, Proxy, Firewalls , DNS • Due to the end to end nature of the role, knowledge in webservers/ operating systems (Linux/windows), Java virtual machines, database interconnectivity, performance tuning backgrounds would have an added advantage • Candidates who possess prior experience in loadbalancing design and implementation would be a plus • Candidate should possess at least 5 years working experience in equivalent environments • Candidate should hold a degree in IT or equivalent qualification • Candidates with current relevant product certifications e.g. CCIE, CISSP etc would have an added advantage • Candidate will need to effectively lead a network related triage or participate actively until resolution • Possess critical thinking and experience to manage high customer impacting scenarios in a logical effective manner is a must

Job_Title: Senior Associate, Product Designer, Consumer Banking Group
Job_Descriptions: Senior Associate, Product Designer, Consumer Banking Group About the design team Hi, we are the DBS user experience design team We create digital products that deserve to be built because they solve real problems in an impactful way with empathy. How we design We go beyond numbers Every dollar means something. No one actually wants money. We want what it can give us. So we acknowledge that money is not really about money. We inject emotion into our products to go from transactional to magical. We have one profound idea Because ambiguity is the enemy of good user experience. What is our unique value proposition? Would adding another feature dilute the idea or make it stronger? What you'll be doing You'll spend most of your time trying to simplify very complex products and ideas. It may be an uphill battle, but it's worth it. If you succeed, your designs will enable thousands of people to serve millions of our customers better. We say that, if you can work in a bank, you can work anywhere. Don't worry, we're a nice bunch of people. Around here, we go out of our way to help one another. You'll spend time with our wonderful research team. Together you'll try to understand the business goals of your project and, more often than not, meet the stakeholders to redefine the problem statement. Once you know where you're going, it's time to tackle the behemoth tech systems and legal restrictions of a bank. Your product manager will become your best friend. You'll message the tech lead more than your parents. You'll get a crash course in finance law. We do respect the privacy of people with headphones-on, trying to avoid eye contact. So you'll have the time to actually produce work you're proud of. We want to hire people who have opinions, believe in their ideas and are willing to fight for them. But we also want people who can recognize when a better argument or solution is put before them. All of us participate in user testing, and so will you. Like we said, producing good work is not good enough if it doesn't get built. We love you, Dribble/Behance. It's not you, it's us. You will meet stakeholders from different departments and articulate your ideas so clearly that you'll become an honorary Toastmaster. To prepare for those meetings you'll need to check the latest relevant data. Before you know it, it will be Friday and time for team dinner, drinks or Creative Day (we do something fun and creative together once a month). Your team and career: You will be part of the DBS enterprise design team. The enterprise design team is redefining what great internal tools look like: working on a collaborative platform to enable bankers, credit risk managers and credit controllers to manage corporate loans digitally. Behind the scenes, the team understands how important it is for a proper design process and system to be in place before great things can happen. Experience You're an end-to-end designer: you can turn high-level requirements into well-posed problem statements, wireframes, prototypes or Powerpoints for the management teams. You can talk confidently and clearly about design and build lasting relationships with our stakeholders. And you're not afraid to improvise-to think on your feet-when required. You can brainstorm the next big thing one moment and still tweak pixels right before launch. You have the ability to prioritize (you don't focus on illustrations if the UX looks like a love child between Frankenstein and Krusty the Clown). You work smart and are ready to improve processes. You have enough curiosity to stay savvy about industry and UX trends. You have confidence in your ideas and the ability to communicate them clearly. You follow through-when built, your designs actually look and work like they should. You monitor products after launch and are ready to suggest improvements. You actively contribute to the UX community. You're kind of a behavioural science geek. You have personal pet projects you work on for fun in your free time. Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognizes your achievements

Retained by my client, a growing private investment firm focusing on growth-stage private credit into leading Southeast Asia technology companies, we are seeking a Partner to join their ranks. This exciting position seeks a driven individual with a proven track record with direct deal-origination, closes and realized investment across SEA especially within the technology sector for growth-stage firms. about the company Partnering with a growing private investment firm focused on growth-stage private credit into leading Southeast Asia technology firms, with plans to expand into growth equity after. about the job Due to successful dual-anchor of over half of $100m fund, we are seeking a Partner with an entrepreneurial desire to be an early core member of a fast-growing firm. This is not a slow-paced corporate siloed role with multiple-layer committees, endless powerpoints and conflicting stakeholders. The Partner needs to be a self-starter in a fast-paced environment juggling numerous key responsibilities as part of the core team. about the manager/team Founded by an experienced investment professional with 18 years of investing experience across Asia with leading investment firms of $3-70B AUM, you will be part of a lean core team with exciting expansion plans for 2022 and beyond. responsibilities and experience required RESPONSIBILITIES . Build an exciting pipeline of leading series B-to-preIPO firms, targeting 3-4 growth-stage debt closes per year. Dig deeply and widely utilzing intellectual rigor to identify exciting emerging industries & firms with highest potential to be leaders. Creatively structure and negotiate investments with attractive risk-return profile. Lead and undertake all deal execution including advisors, legal, financial, commercial diligence. Lead and prepare investment memos detailing structure, financial analysis, risk-reward assessment. Absolutely critical to be a strong "team player". Intellectual curiosity yet humility, respectful deal discussion approach, co-operative and helpful to senior/junior colleagues alike. Help coach and build out junior team as asset base grows. Interest to expand into growth equity. QUALIFICATIONS 7-10 years direct deal-origination, closes, realized investments across Southeast Asia. Prior China exposure a plus but not necessary Senior role at leading venture debt, venture capital, growth equity, family office or commercial/investment bank. Strong interest in technology and growth-stage firms. Experience investing across either or combination of venture debt, growth-stage credit, venture/growth equity from Series A-to-pre-IPO Skilled in building and maintaining relationships with founders, C-level, VC firms and intermediaries. Ability to read, write and discuss deals in Chinese an advantage to liaise with stakeholders in China Top-tier university education credentials, MBA from leading school an advantage COMPENSATION . Competitive base salary. Meaningful carried interest. Attractive GP equity stake. To apply online please use the 'apply' function, alternatively you may contact Ignatius D'Cruz at 6510 6516. (EA: 94C3609/ R1762883 )

Job_Title: Ops Support Executive, Data Centre & BCP
Job_Descriptions: See job description for details NCS is a leading information and communications technology (ICT) and communications engineering services provider across the Asia-Pacific region. We are headquartered in Singapore and a wholly owned subsidiary of the Singtel Group. We have in-depth domain knowledge and unique capabilities that create business value for customers. We offer a broad range of services, including consulting, systems development and integration, business process outsourcing, infrastructure management and solutions, and technology solutions. The broad area of your job responsibilities will cover the following: Monitoring and Escalation - SolarWind alerts, NetBackup jobs, Batch jobs processing including backups (e.g., execute/submit, monitor and handle jobs according to work instructions defined) Tape media management for on-site and off-site storage Job Scheduling using scheduling software provided Daily Reports - Server and network monitoring, backup status & etc. 24x7 Point of Contact for ASOC (Escalation list to be provided) CyberArk Privilege password approvals (act only upon seeing approval email from LTA) Server health checks Start-up, shut-up, reboot systems, restart services, etc. Print Operations e.g., generation & distribution of reports, housekeep of printers, etc. Initiate prompt actions for tasks indicated on the checklists Ensure proper hand-over to next shift team member Provide data & information for Incident Report Logging of events according to defined procedure Liaise with users/customers on project related operational matters Respond promptly to incident and escalate immediately to next level support as per pre-defined procedure Assist in investigating and troubleshooting of reported issues. Aid administrator/engineers in remote management and troubleshooting Assist Project Manager in the inventory of hardware equipment in Data Centre. Inventory list provided by PM Assist in enforcing security access authorization base on authorization list provided by Project Manager/owner Participate in DR Exercise Collection of server / data for monthly reporting. Maintenance of the PCs provided by the project team: Windows patching, cloning of machine, hardware faulty, etc. The ideal candidate should possess: Diploma Computer Information Systems or related field. Minimum 1 year of experience in Batch Management Familiar with: Control-M 9.0.19.x: Fundamentals , Basic SAP, Data Centre Operations Support, ITIL methodologies Possess initiative with positive working attitudes and customer services oriented; Independent and goal-oriented; Strong teamwork, communication and interpersonal skills;

Job_Title: Redshift Database Engineer, 6 month contract renewable
Job_Descriptions: Redshift Database Engineer, 6 month contract renewable About TEKsystems: We're in the business of building tomorrow. It's not about reading the signs and making sure you're ready, it's about deciding where and how you want to get to the next level. At TEKsystems, we're obsessed with technology. Its power to change everything. Technology fuels our passion and commitment to helping organisations do what they set out to. When we engage, we bring fresh ideas that help you galvanise your performance. Refine your strategy. Spark new energy. The future-and how we get there-depends on those who build, connect, create and transform our world. The most successful and innovative businesses are already doing it, and we're skilled experts at bringing the talent they need to thrive. Job Description: You will lead a new project to upgrade, build and optimise a new Data Warehouse / Data Lake combination. As a senior member of the team your role will encompass elements of project management to set and drive the product roadmap, allocation of resources and provision of technical leadership. You'll be working in a technology driven environment utilising the latest tools and techniques such as Redshift, S3, Lambda, DynamoDB, Athena and Kafka. Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture by designing and implementing data ingestion solutions on AWS using AWS native services or using data management technologies such as Talend or Informatica hosted on AWS. Integrate and assemble large, complex data sets using AWS services such as Glue that meet a broad range of business requirements. Design and optimize data models on AWS Cloud using AWS data stores such as Redshift, RDS, S3 Integrate AWS or 3rd party KMS, HSM with AWS data services for building secure data solutions Operationalize self service data preparation tools e.g. Trifacta and Paxata on AWS. Design operations architecture and conduct performance engineering for large scale data lakes in production environment Participate in client design workshops and provide tradeoffs and recommendations towards building solutions. Mentor other engineers in coding best practices and problem solving. Requirements Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent work experience 10+ years of experience using databases, out of which 5 years hands on experience of Amazon Redshift Architecture or equivalent Columnar DB. Hands on experience in Data Warehouse (DW) and BI tools is mandatory Should understand nuances of moving data from RDBMS sources to Columnar DB (Redshift) AWS Pipeline knowledge to develop ETL for data movement to Redshift Strong knowledge on AWS environment and Service knowledge with S3 storage understanding Strong knowledge multiple cloud technologies including VPC, EC2, S3, Amazon API Gateway, DynamoDB, SimpleDB, AWS Route 53 For more information you can email Michelle Hoang in our Singapore office on michelle.hoang@teksystems.com quoting Job Reference 527697 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest. http://jobs.en-sg.teksystems.com/TtaOqI/redshift-database-engineer-6-month-contract-renewable-itcommunications-singapore-central-singapore-14872755 Allegis Group Singapore Pte Ltd, Company Reg No. 200909448N, EA License No. 10C4544

Posted by: Jacylnn Tan Onsite Recruitment Lead View profile & contact 2022 Operations Academy Programme - Singapore Company Overview We're a global investment manager. We help institutions, intermediaries and individuals around the world invest money to meet their goals, fulfil their ambitions, and prepare for the future. We have around 5,000 people on six continents. And we've been around for over 200 years, but keep adapting as society and technology changes. What doesn't change is our commitment to helping our clients, and society, prosper. We're committed to investing sustainably and integrate Environment, Social and Corporate Governance (ESG) into our decision-making across all investments whilst maintaining long term performance for our clients. We can back this up with our impact measurement tool which combines measures of harm and good effect of companies to provide the overall social and environmental impact. Our Operations Team We support our global business by providing high quality and efficient operational oversight, processing and reporting across all of our business channels. Operations covers a broad spectrum of responsibilities from ensuring confirmation and settlement of trade activity, daily oversight of the funds Net Asset Value (NAV) to ensuring that we meet all of our Client, Fund and regulatory reporting obligations. It's a busy and dynamic area with many exciting opportunities to build and develop your career. The Base In Singapore, Schroders' presence dates back to the mid-1970s. Since then, we have successfully built a strong local franchise and are one of the largest asset management companies in Singapore today. We manage funds for a broad range of clients including official institutions, sovereign wealth funds, insurance companies, charities, government-linked companies, high net worth individuals and retail investors. Singapore is our Asia Pacific operations hub, providing operational oversight to other offices in the region such as Australia, Indonesia, Hong Kong and Japan. The team constantly seeks to develop and adopt innovative and collaborative solutions to bring the best results for our clients. The Programme You will join as a permanent employee and start your career in the Operations Academy before moving into a dedicated team.  Over the two-year programme, you will be rotated across a number of areas to give you an introduction into operations.  You will also have the opportunity to network and meet with the wider business groups, which will give you insight into the world of asset management. We want you to be innovative and creative in your approach in understanding what we do and how we do it. We will provide training throughout the two-year programme which will cover: aspects of the asset management industry via accredited learning to gain the Level 3 - Investment Operations Certificate; functional knowledge through a regular rotation into different teams; application training as part of the on-the-job experience; as well as non-functional training, such as organisation skills and written/verbal communication effectiveness, to help broaden your overall skills set. You will learn from experienced colleagues as they guide you through the various applications and processes which will allow you perform your role more efficiently. The knowledge, experience, and qualifications • Demonstrates strong communication skills and working well within a team environment. • Experience of prioritising workload, demonstrating a keen eye for detail, problem solving and confidence in communicating escalations when required. • Show great interpersonal and analytical skills. We will teach what you need to know about the job. We just need you to bring your drive, passion and enthusiasm to make the most of the opportunity. The candidate we are looking for We take pride in hiring the right people for our programmes. People who can hit the ground running and want to make a difference. • We look for people who are naturally curious about the world around them and who are eager to learn more about our industry and what we do. • We want someone who is not afraid to bring new ideas to the table • You are someone who is flexible and able to think independently, be proactive and an advocate for change • A team player with strong communication and collaboration skills are essential as you will work as part of a team to overcome challenges and share ideas. • A growth mindset: we understand you may make mistakes, and when you do, we are looking for you to learn from these • We want you to contribute to our continuously evolving culture, whether it's participating in our recreational clubs and campaigns or starting your own. Recruitment process 1.    Online application form and CV 2.    Online assessments 3.    Online video interview 4.    Assessment centre 5.    Final round interview Applications will close approximately 2-3 weeks before the assessment centre, but please note that we recruit on a rolling basis so we would recommend that you apply early.

Job_Title: SVP/VP, Team Head, Central Program Office, Consumer Banking Group - (WD23906)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business – they were made just right for you. Lead the Central Programme Office to strengthen business origination, work with various business partners including Business Analytics, Sales Distribution, Marketing and Products. Support and oversee business planning leveraging on a data-driven model to manage and drive business activities to support investment and insurance business. Responsibilities Develop clear strategies to generate more sources of business origination to support the growth of Investment and Insurance business Collaborate and co-create strategies/plans with multiple business partners, to drive performance of business origination channels with a focus on online to offline customer acquisition and engagement Support and oversee monthly business planning leveraging on a data driven operating model in collaboration with stakeholders across various functions including distribution channels, marketing and product Oversee the DBS Workplace Banking Programme and develop strategies to build engagement with companies to promote employee financial wellbeing Requirements Bachelor Degree with minimum 8-12 years experiences in Business Analytics, Sales Distribution, and/or Channel management experience will be advantageous Proven leadership skills Strong analytical skills and business acumen Strong interpersonal and communication skills Good organization and project management skills Pro-active, creative and independent Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.
